SENT.plain: We report on a new patient with clinical findings consistent with acro-dermato-ungual-lacrimal-tooth (ADULT) syndrome
The child had sparse hair, extensive freckling, lacrimal duct stenosis, oligodontia, dystrophic nails, reduced sweating, and bilateral athelia
Examination of his hands showed ulnar ray hypoplasia with bilateral fifth finger brachydactyly and camptodactyly
He also had surgical repair of an imperforate anus
Mutation analysis of TP63 showed a single nucleotide substitution, c.G518A, predicting a novel missense mutation, p.V114M in exon 4
This is the third mutation to be reported in TP63 in ADULT syndrome
